comments.commentBody: Show me a politician he hasn't lied

Just wish I could figure out how to be pro-Democracy, pro-sanity, pro-America without being pro-Hillary.  I'm afraid this may sound sexist (In my defense I can only say I'd be avidly supporting Nancy Pelosu or Liz Warren), but I feel that Hillary has me by the short hairs.  I'll vote for her, but that's it.  I'm finished with the Democatic Party, except for supporting progressive candidates in the primaries.

It's incredible to see how hard the New York Times is rooting for a particular candidate. I understand that Hillary Clinton is, and always has been, a thoroughgoing establishment politician, of the kind that the paper would like to have in power. Nevertheless, the New York Times should at least feigned an attempt to hold the Democratic Party responsible for the categorical fact that it tried to sway the primaries--even if only to maintain its own veneer of fairness and its standing as the liberal voice of record.

Of course, Trump responded to the interviewer's question about the fallen Muslim soldier like an idiot. If he had any intelligence, he would have expressed sympathy to the parents for their loss, and pointed out that if Capt. Humayun Khan had not been deployed in an illegal war that was supported by Clinton enthusiastically, he could have been with his family today.

A lot of people complain about the things Trump says about specific issues, whether military, or geo-political, or economic. On the other hand, most people against Clinton, including the Sanders Democrats, object to the very positions taken by Clinton, not just her well-rehearsed descriptions of her positions. This concerted media onslaught against Trump is actually a proxy propaganda war against Vladimir Putin. Let us hope that some sanity prevails, and the great powers do not come to war in the course of the next few years.
Could you clarify what you mean by white working-class? Just curious about how you delimit that classification.

The trajectory of Trump's candidacy reminds me of the movie and Broadway play, "The Producers." Trump seems to be doing everything he can, and I mean everything folks, to ensure a huge failure for his candidacy in November. Insulting a Gold Star Family and a fallen American hero is beyond the pale, even for DJT. In the language of Wall Street, he seems to be "shorting" his own run.

That's all ok, until you remember how The Producers ended.

It may not be "Springtime for Hitler", only because the season is wrong. So maybe "Autumn Leaves for Trump" will be a big musical hit later this year.

Sure hope not.

It's not only WikiLeaks that is likely to change public opinion. Any further breakout of either police killings or ISIS terrorism will do much to focus the minds of the public on real, as opposed to media manufactured, issues in this election.

And I think that the debates will also favor Trump, although one can predict as well that his performance will be panned by everyone in the increasingly obviously biased media. Why will he be favored? Because, on the issues, it is Clinton, and not Trump, who is totally out of touch with the public.

Who in the larger public thinks that BLM is anything but bad news? Who in the larger public thinks, as does Hillary, that the answer to ISIS terrorism is a vast increase in the number of Muslims allowed to immigrate? Who in the larger public thinks that our exercises in power in Libya and Syria and Iraq have been anything but disasters? Who in the larger public thinks that increased immigration, and globalistic trade deals profits American workers?

The one thing Hillary can't survive is an election based on the issues. And Trump should be able to communicate his position on these issues, and contrast them with Hillary.
I wholeheartedly wish America could have a bright future, may Trump be buried with his sheer amount of lies and bs
No, it speaks to their justifiable cynicism and refusal to be duped. You can't fool all of the people all of the time, not even Democrats.

I was a Bernie supporter, but of course will vote for Hillary.

The Dem Committee emails released by Assange, are damaging to Debbie Wasserman Schultz and some of her associates. But those emails have little effect on Hillary's election.

Assange will probably also release info bad for Trump, perhaps his tax returns or other embarrassing personal financial information.

Trump will keep sticking his head in a dark place, and will lose badly.

In 2016, the Dems will win the Presidency, Senate, Supreme Court nominations, and perhaps the House of Reps.

I agree. People need to vote. No need to be overconfident, as voter turnout in the US trails behind 30 other countries http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2016/08/02/u-s-voter-turnout-trails... Without an incumbent president, projections are even back to dismal 2008 levels. Young people must come out and vote, and vote like they're going to the biggest party of their lives. They need to participate this time, precisely because the programs Hillary (and Bernie) are offering are for their future. Now would it be too late to propose that the elections be on a weekend or that it be declared a holiday, like in other countries? That would do it.
Excellent, looks like Hillary has it in the bag. I probably won't even bother to vote.

Trump has dropped a fair share of "bombs" on himself. Hasn't that also turned the election?  If you know something all of us don't know, cite your sources and provide your links. Otherwise, it just sounds like the wishful thinking of someone who's been brainwashed to dislike Clinton -- e.g., "lock her up," and "She's the devil." etc.
In what way did the replacement of Agnew with Ford not go well?  Ford served honorably as President and was defeated in the free and fair election that followed his completion of Nixon's second term.

There is another reason for hope that Hillary’s Poll Bounce will persist through the summer. In typical Trump fashion, he has launched a four day Twitter tirade against the Muslim Gold Star Family, the Khans. As you well know, Mr. Khan was using his First Amendment Rights, when he gave a critique of Trump at the DNC Convention last week. That sent Trump into a Twitter Tizzy. In spite of the negative blowback from Democrats, Veterans’ Groups and some Republicans, Trump still persists in his attacks. Trump cannot help himself.

Basically, Trump is immature and has no impulse control. Trump fits the definition of Impulse Control Disorder NOS. This is “defined as a predisposition toward rapid, unplanned reactions to either internal or external stimuli without regard for negative consequences”

WEB: http://www.psychiatrictimes.com/impulse-control-disorders/impulse-contro...

Based on Trump’s reaction to criticism from Khazir Khan, a private citizen, all of Trump’s followers should be very wary. If Trump were “President” and you used your First Amendment Rights to criticize him or his policies in an Op Ed, Comment or Tweet, “President” Trump would hit you with a barrage of vicious Tweets. Trump would also have the power and prestige of the US Presidency at his finger tips. The Secret Service, FBI, US Justice Department and IRS have wide latitudes of power in our country.
Herr Trump is being attacked for his advocacy on banning all Muslim's from entering the U.S. Let's stay on topic.
For someone who worked so hard to avoid fighting in a foreign country, I wonder why he is so pugnacious in ours?

"Trump's comments some weeks ago about McCain....."
* * *
July 18, 2105 when the comment was made was more than some weeks ago.
A good parody of Trump, indeed.

It's certainly a good idea to challenge the influence of ISIS in Libya but, once again, why is the U.S. playing the key role here?  That terrorist organization has already murdered Egyptian citizens in eastern Libya and impacted the flow of refugees across the Mediterranean to Italy.  Where is the Egyptian air force?  Where are the Italians?  And even if we manage to drive ISIS out of Surt and other areas in Tripolitania they'll most likely head south into Fezzan and then across the Sahel.  ISIS shouldn't be dealt with with pinpricks, whether in Libya, Syria or Iraq.  What's needed is a U.N.-authorized force made up of every nation threatened by these barbarians- including the U.S., Russia, China, India, Pakistan, Turkey, Italy, our other Western European allies, Egypt and every other Sunni Arab nation.  Why have we not even petitioned the U.N. for such authorization?  His failure to do so is, to my mind, one of Mr. Obama's biggest mistakes on the foreign policy front- far more so than the well-intended decision to establish a no-fly zone to stop Qaddafi from reaching Benghazi.
He's already tried the NFL letter. Too bad he was caught in another lie.
Yikes, don't believe everything you read. Especially if it's barely half-there, incomplete and laughable stuff like wikileaks. Pfffft!
Yikes, this wasn't about Trump causing his death or about screening immigrants. It does not help to make arguments that don't add up to justify your anger and politics.
Apparently Republicans do not mind "sedition" and they proved it this week. The Uniform Code of Military Justice is "for the little people" and not for Republicans and their pals.

You have the most liked reader comment which I guess is no surprise. Another off-the-cuff reaction that gets a cheer. Yet, the whole point of the article is to go beyond that knee-jerk feeling and see deeper into what a veteran **player** presence brings. I don't like Arod. But since his 2015 return, someone put some sense into him, and finally he's doing everything exactly right. You can't ask more of a man, of a professional, than that. The article also notes how it makes little sense to release him this year. The team is out of contention and rosters will expand soon. They can release him next spring. The Yanks aren't trying to help him get to 700. It looks like they might even be happy if he doesn't.

Heck of a lot of money to be spending on a "teacher," especially considering that the Yankees already employee a manager and a bunch of coaches to act in that capacity.  They'd be better off just cutting him loose and eating what remains of his contract.  Maybe there's another team out there whose players can use a lesson or two on subjects like hitting, steroids and lying about steroids.

and Elke
This puzzle was geared at us older folks ; what with AL OERTER, ERNIE Kovacs, Mel TORME , Paul ANKA . I GoT IT with WIBLOWINND.
My favourite one is the last one , RASINGININ. While it's clued as a hit for Gene Kelly, I really like Kurt Browning's version on SKATEs on ICE(E):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JXtd7xq7URM
Fun puzzle.
